Body:
I think this is a very basic question.

Whom will you invite?

Why doesn't the subject you block the movement of whom?

I'll try an answer: the movement of whom is not an A-movement because it isn't case-driven. Therefore it doesn't hop on A positions and it just goes from complement of VP to [Spec, CP], with no intermediate steps.
Title: Why doesn't the subject prevent WH- extraction of an internal argument?

LastEditedUser.AboutMe:
Travelling armchair linguist.

Never studied in an institution but read books and web with probably more breadth than depth.

Always on the road surviving in a strange foreign language, currently Mongolian and Mandarin Chinese.

And I collect dictionaries.
